Summary An articulate and empathetic marketing and business development professional with multi-faceted global experiences is interested in transformational opportunities of “impact” and passionate about innovation and leveraging technology to build bridges across communities. 
 
Professional Experience & Skills Summary: 
•	6+ years of experience in higher education developing compelling programs, strategic alliances and new marketing channels for engagement at Stanford University following on 8+ years of experience in the fashion and retail industry managing all phases of the product development and supply chain management processes  
•	Empathetic team leader with the demonstrated ability to facilitate successful business partnerships with individuals across industries and departments including C-Suite executives 
•	Guest Speaker on Asian Mobile Internet at the 2012 Google IO International Reception 
•	Guest Speaker at Stanford Staff Seminars on "Harnessing the Power of the LinkedIn Network" 
•	Successfully managed an IT team remotely to overhaul and redesign the corporate reporting process 
•	Demonstrated proficiency in the usage of pivot tables, relational databases, charts, other software systems and web-based analytic tools including Google Analytics to generate new leads and illustrate analysis 
•	Global and Cross-cultural experiences include teaching English in an agrarian community in Southern China followed by 4 months in Beijing in addition to 6 months in Europe, 3 months in Taiwan and mentoring emerging women leaders from the Middle East and North Africa region through the 2011 & 2012 TechWomen program 
•	Exceptional project management skills and ability to master new information and technological processes quickly 
•	Recognized by Linkedin in 2012 as one of the top 1% of most viewed Linkedin profiles

Fiscal Affairs Administrator Stanford University April 2015  –  July 2015  (4 months) Office of Fiscal Affairs, School of Medicine • Provided administrative and complex calendar support to Chief Financial Officer, Director of Budget and Planning, Director of Faculty Compensation, and Controller of Stanford Medicine. 
• Assisted in the planning and coordination of upcoming office moves and renovation. 
• Processed and verified financial transactions, i.e., travel reimbursements; office supplies; department MasterCard custodian; vendor invoices. 
• Composed correspondence; performed substantial editing and fact checking on departmental documents for presentation to Dean’s Office, Provost Office, Office of the General Counsel, and Board of Trustees. SeRA Client Support Analyst Stanford University July 2010  –  November 2012  (2 years 5 months) Office of Sponsored Research •	Managed and provided excellent and timely help desk and technical support for University-wide SeRA (Stanford Electronic Research Administration) system. Functioned as a proactive customer advocate to help ensure end user requests, including faculty, department administrators, and central office research administrators were properly managed through the appropriate issue resolution procedures. 
•	Organized and attended end user forums and other related activities to understand areas where additional support could enhance end user’s effectiveness with SeRA. 
•	Based on an in-depth understanding of the system platform, continuously developed broad competencies across all SeRA applications and the research processes they supported, to better understand the inter-dependencies and data flow between SeRA applications and other Stanford systems. 
•	Provided application testing and worked closely with the SeRA team identifying user issues that needed to be resolved by bug fixes, enhancements and change requests. 
•	Advised and assisted in the support of new system rollouts and upgrades by contributing to implementation plans and/or team training sessions. 
•	Participated in conducting user training sessions and assisted in developing on-line and classroom training resources for SeRA applications. 
•	Assisted in managing website(s) relating to SeRA applications. Training Coordinator Stanford University July 2008  –  July 2010  (2 years 1 month) Office of Research Administration •	Operated the help desk for the Learning Management System (STARS) for Office of Research Administration (ORA) systems and classes. 
•	Provided Tier II support to resolve issues with client’s activity/certification records and technical issues. 
•	Ensured that the ORA training courses, and those for groups supported by ORA, were accurately listed in STARS and the on-line university training opportunities guide. 
•	Maintained accurate attendee/test result records. Responded to instructor and student inquiries. 
•	Was the main point of contact for, and represented ORA, at STARS user group meetings. 
•	Coordinated the ORA Cardinal Curriculum Certificate program – a series of classes designed to train and aid the research administration community on campus.  
•	Coordinated preparation and publication of training documents and recording of e-learning materials. 
•	Coordinated logistical support for all Research Administration classes: scheduled class times and facilities; instructors, classrooms and equipment. Organized materials and computer set up.  
•	Reviewed training materials for accuracy and completeness, updated, and reproduced them prior to instructor-led classes. 
•	Ensured all ORA websites were up to date and accurate, including content and links to other sites. 
•	Assisted in creating new content as required, ensuring consistent “branding” and quality standards. 
•	Adapted materials and information obtained from subject matter experts (SMEs) and technical experts to effectively communicate critical information to research administrators throughout the University via reference documents, training materials, job aids, and presentations. 
•	Coordinated Research Meetings, Satellite Workshops, periodic conferences, and other ORA meetings as necessary. Human Resources Associate Stanford University August 2002  –  March 2007  (4 years 8 months) Office of the President and Provost •	Was responsible for managing new employee trial period progress. Worked with supervisors and HR Manager to aid in successful completion. 
•	Primary contact for all leaves of absence (Family Medical Leave, Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, Worker's Compensation, and Family Temporary Disability). Worked closely with disability and WC carriers.

•	PeopleSoft – Manage HR Records: Processed all PS transactions including hiring, reclassifications and pay changes, terminations. Manage Positions: Processed any position number requests from opening position numbers to changing existing information, as well as inactivating out of use positions.  
•	Ran HR and Oracle reports checking for personnel changes, gross pay/additional pay, record changes, charging discrepancies. Analyzed results to determine if any actions needed to be taken on inaccuracies.  
•	Served as Kronos Time and Leave Administrator for seven PPO departments, and back-up administrator for all others. Acted as Local Expert for all Kronos activities.  
•	Entered and maintained job requisition postings for PPO. Recruiting Coordinator Stanford University January 2002  –  August 2002  (8 months) Information Technology Systems & Services •	Was responsible for coordinating the hiring process for all Information Technology Systems and Services positions.

Summary Trained as a professional listener and problem solver in her prior career as a social worker, Margo is adept at helping people achieve their goals and dreams. After completing her Bachelors degree in Sociology at McGill University in Canada, she received a Masters degree in Social Work at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. As a social worker, Margo acquired extensive experience and expertise counseling individuals, couples and families, and most importantly, linking people to the resources and services that enrich and improve their lives. 
 
Margo invests considerable time and energy in her business as well as personal relationships, and is a communicator above all. Honesty and high integrity are essential to her professionalism in dealings with clients and colleagues alike. As an avid people person, problem solver and information gatherer, she welcomes the opportunity to help her clients fulfill the dream of finding a home ideally suited to their individual needs and preferences. Customer service is the cornerstone of Margo’s professional relationships. She is committed to maintaining her clients’ needs as her first priority, keeping abreast of current market conditions, and continually sharpening her marketing and negotiating skills for optimum results.  
 
Margo has advanced her expertise and knowledge base by obtaining a California Real Estate Broker license. She is a member of the Silicon Valley Association of Realtors, California Association of Realtors, and the National Association of Realtors. 
 
Specialties:  
California Real Estate Broker 
SRES Senior Real Estate Specialist  
RELO Relocation Specialist
